abstract.p: Opera Festival of New Jersey is set to open third monthlong season at McCarter Theater with performance of Carmen; schedule (S)

block.p: The progression of operas to be performed by the Opera Festival of New Jersey goes like this: piece of cake, pretty easy, intriguing, and wow. To wit: the company's third monthlong season at McCarter Theater begins on Saturday with ''Carmen.'' The following Saturday is the first performance of ''Falstaff.''
Venturing into the operatic wilderness, the festival then presents Hugo Weisgall's ''Six Characters in Search of an Author.'' The season concludes with Frank Lewin's 1993 ''Burning Bright.''
